metadata.title: CVE-2019-5853 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - untriaged
metadata.description:
Inappropriate implementation in JavaScript in Google Chrome prior to76.0.3809.87 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heapcorruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5853` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
